Świetna gra. Sama gra opowiada o naukowcu z black mesa, który w nieudanym  eksperymencie przyzywa obcych z xen. Nasza postać prawdopodobnie po raz pierwszy otrzymuje broń i walczy z tymi obcymi. Sama gra jest nawet długa,w grze mamy strój H.E.V oraz paczki z zdrowiem oraz z dodatkowym bateriami co uzupełnia nasze drugie zdrowie do większej odporności i  strój też gada kiedy naprzykład zbierzemy trochę doładowań kiedy spadniemy z dużej wysokości albo inne niebezpieczeństwa jak ogień,toksyny,czy hemia.
 Gameplay jest bardzo dobry,Zabijanie oraz szczelanie jest tutaj świetne,Weźmy pod uwagę, że ta gra została wydana w 1998 roku i jak na tamte lata była strasznie dobra zarówno graficznie, i jak nie tylko i gra była bardzo rewolucyjna.Sama gra się trochę zestarzała ale nadal jest Bardzo dobra..Poprostu klasyk gier polecam.

Good Game

An often janky, irritating and dated game, feels like a prelude to HL2, with annyoingly tanky enemies, weapons that (bar the revolver) feel like super soakers, and an overall sense of not knowing where to go or why to go there. Play HL2 instead, it is infinitely better.

3/10

Jednak są też plusy: pierwszy to fabuła bo mimo swoich lat dalej wciąga, a drugi to fakt że są już 2 remastery tej że gry więc nie trzeba się z tą grą pierdolić cały czas i można ograć tą zacną fabułę jeszcze raz w lepszym wydaniu.

Half-Life is an action-adventure first-person shooter set in the bowels of a mountain in the US state of New Mexico. It is there, according to the plot, that the federal research center of gigantic proportions, bearing the name "Black Mesa", is located, and it is there that a number of top-secret studies are carried out. The main character of the game is a young talented researcher Gordon Freeman, who works in the laboratory of anomalous materials.

An average-cleared scientist is unaware of the dangers of the work ahead. One morning, Gordon is sent to the test chamber for routine crystal analysis. The consequences of the experiment, however, are disastrous. The explosion of the crystal breaks a gap between the dimensions, from where alien forces begin to attack the Earth. Gordon, caught between the aliens and the US Army, seeks to get out of the complex before he is found and destroyed.
Play NOW!

I never enjoyed this game and I honestly struggle to truly understand why. It left such a mediocre taste in my mouth that it took me 8 years to get around to the rest of the franchise - Which I now love. It's for this reason that I wouldn't recommend this to new players, yet I strongly enjoyed Black Mesa (a modernised remake). I would recommend buying that instead as it does what the rest of the franchise does well and adds a bit more of an atmosphere. I can't write too deep a review as it's been 8 years since I played it, but having remembered parts through Black Mesa I would say that conceptually it was fantastic and anyone looking for an old school shooter without any modern visuals should go ahead and buy this over Black Mesa. Honestly a true technical marvel of it's time, but it just didn't resonate with me in any way.

Just finished this game and it took me way longer than i expected, partially because i finished portal in a couple of hours and expected the same of half life. 

I think its a fun game, graphics, bugs, weird movement, dialogue volume too low compared to environment noise in certain sections i can excuse to it being an old game/ being an fps. 

I haven't played an fps before and maybe that's why i struggled with this game a bit but on several occasions i had to load last save a ton of times in order to get a section done or clear enemies with enough health/ammo (this holds true especially for the later sections). 

Some parts took way too long but that was sometimes because of me missing an interactive button or lever. Or not knowing that there was passage through that particular area but that's okay. That's what exploration is about.

The later sections were really hard for me and I had to look up a walkthrough for the final three sections due to not being able to figure out that i could destroy crystals/struggling with a fight/again not know that there was a passage in a particular place.

The story was a bit hazy for me since we travelled a lot and things were very diverse from what we originally started with.

Overall i don't know I give this game a positive or a negative but I think its worth trying out anyway. Gunning down enemies is always fun.

It's Half Life. Don't need to say much more but as someone who had never played the game until a couple of days ago I couldn't really explain why Half Life is so special. There are a million of videos out there that do capture that feeling but honestly buy Half Life and try it. It's an experience. One of Gaming Histories Milestones and earns every bit of that reputation.

Gordon freeman

I decided to play this after 20 years and holy ****, the game industry surely regressed. It still proves why it is a classic and a pioneer of a certain genre. I can praise a lot of things, map designs, the story etc. It is challenging, like other games of its era, which is really fun for me because I really don't enjoy the games being made too easy to appeal to everyone. Some of the stuff are really basic but the way I could interact with the environment sometimes made me think "wait, was this possible 24 years ago? then why I can interact less in modern games".

If you played it years ago, give it a shot, you'll like it even more and appreciate it a lot.
